intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum subsp. leucolepis, commonly known as the white leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are pale yellow to white, with prominent central disk florets, and it blooms from late summer into autumn. This species is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and is also valued for its ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
